meanings.sent1: The rabbit had auriculated ears that twitched at every sound.
meanings.sent2: The auriculated seashell had intricate ear-like patterns on its surface.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's auriculated ears were so big, they could pick up radio signals!
meanings.sent4: The auriculated clouds in the sky resembled giant ears listening to the world below.
meanings.sent5: The auriculated flower petals seemed to hear the whispers of the wind.

meanings.definition: Having a shape resembling an ear.
meanings.sent1: The pastry had an auriculated design that made it look like a tiny ear.
meanings.sent2: The seashell had an auriculated curve that mimicked the shape of a human ear.
meanings.sent3: The auriculated cloud in the sky looked like a giant ear trying to hear the conversations below.
meanings.sent4: The auriculated rock formation on the mountain resembled a massive ear listening to the world.
meanings.sent5: The auriculated leaf on the tree seemed to be listening to the rustling of the wind.

meanings.definition: Having a jointed or articulated structure.
meanings.sent1: The robot had an auriculated arm that could bend and move like a human elbow.
meanings.sent2: The toy had auriculated legs that allowed it to walk and run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The auriculated door hinge squeaked as it moved, sounding like a tiny creature with joints.
meanings.sent4: The auriculated bridge spanned the river, flexing and moving with the weight of passing cars.
meanings.sent5: The auriculated puppet's limbs danced gracefully, showing off its articulated joints.
